body: Can you please share your project structure?
Please provide steps to reproduce and `tauri info` output

Hi I have the same issue when I am running ` yarn tauri android init` on Windows 11 , no issues on Mac machine. 
For reference `yarn tauri info`
`

[-] App

    - bundler: Webpack
    `
Could you please advice if any solutions?

I'm getting the same error in windows when my project isn't on disk C:

When the project is on C: - one of the messages says

```
Info "C:\\Program Files\\nodejs\\node.exe" relative to "C:\\proj\\thingy\\src-tauri" is "..\\..\\..\\Program Files\\nodejs\\node.exe"
```

So looks like it's trying to get a relative path from your project to nodejs executable.

On windows, if they are both on different disks - this is impossible so it panics.

tauri info:

```
[‚úî] Environment
    - OS: Windows 10.0.22621 X64
    ‚úî WebView2: 121.0.2277.98
    ‚úî MSVC: Visual Studio Community 2022

[-] Packages

    - wry [RUST]: 0.35.2
    - tao [RUST]: 0.25.0
    - @tauri-apps/api [NPM]: 2.0.0-beta.0
    - @tauri-apps/cli [NPM]: 2.0.0-beta.1

[-] App
    - build-type: bundle
    - CSP: unset
    - frontendDist: ../dist
    - devUrl: http://localhost:1420/
    - framework: React
    - bundler: Vite
```

Same issue. Steps to reproduce:

issue.title: [bug] tauri 2.0 android init failed due to path issues on Windows

labels.name: status: needs triage
labels.description: This issue needs to triage, applied to new issues

repository.name: tauri
repository.description: Build smaller, faster, and more secure desktop and mobile applications with a web frontend.

issue.body:
### Describe the bug

`cargo tauri android init` fails when the path is linked.
I am not sure what is the correct way to describe it, but basically it is a `dir` under path `A` but actually linked to path `B`, just like a symlink created by the command `ln -s B A/dir` on linux.

I found a working way but the problem is still there.

I have my repos in `E:\para\Repos`, and linked it to `C:\Users\para\Repos`:

```sh
$ ls -l C:\Users\para\Repos
lrwxrwxrwx    8 para     para            14 Nov 06 21:17 C:\Users\para\Repos -> E:/para/Repos/
```

First, I cd into `C:\Users\para\Repos\tapp`, and executing `tauri android init` gives me such error:

```
thread 'main' panicked at C:\Users\para\.cargo\registry\src\index.crates.io-6f17d22bba15001f\tauri-cli-2.0.0-alpha.21\src\mobile\mod.rs:317:6:
called `Result::unwrap()` on an `Err` value: AssetDirOutsideOfAppRoot { asset_dir: "assets", root_dir: "C:\\Users\\para\\Repos\\tapp\\src-tauri" }
```

I looked into the mentioned file, and found a function takes the linked path `C:\Users\para\Repos\tapp` correctly at start, but translates it to the original path `E:\para\Repos\tapp` when actually comparing, which introduces inconsistency.

Then I tried to execute `tauri android init` from `E:\para\Repos`, which is the original path with no symlink, but got a different error:

```
thread 'main' panicked at C:\Users\para\.cargo\registry\src\index.crates.io-6f17d22bba15001f\cargo-mobile2-0.8.0\src\util\path.rs:136:13:
internal error: entered unreachable code: `abs_src` and `abs_dest` have no common root
```
Looked into the code again, I guess it is using `C:\` as `abs_src` and `E:\` as `abs_dest` (or vice versa, they are different anyway), results in the `no common root` error.

Finally, I moved the project folder to a directory under  `C:\`, and it works.

### Reproduction

As described above.

Issue 1:
1. On windows, create a symlink and use it as the parent folder.
2. `cd` into the symlinked path, and create a tauri 2.0 app `cargo create-tauri-app --alpha` here, run `cargo tauri android init`

Issue 2:
1. On windows, create a tauri 2.0 app `cargo create-tauri-app --alpha` on non-C drive (I am not very sure about this, maybe system drive? or the drive rust/cargo is installed?)
2. run `cargo tauri android init`



### Expected behavior

```log
        Info "C:\\Users\\para\\.cargo\\bin\\cargo-tauri.exe" relative to "C:\\Users\\para\\Documents\\tapp\\src-tauri" is "..\\..\\..\\.cargo\\bin\\cargo-tauri.exe"
Generating Android Studio project...
        Info "C:\\Users\\para\\Documents\\tapp\\src-tauri" relative to "C:\\Users\\para\\Documents\\tapp\\src-tauri\\gen/android\\app" is "..\\..\\..\\"
victory: Project generated successfully!
    Make cool apps! üåª üêï üéâ
```

### Full `tauri info` output

```text
[‚úî] Environment
    - OS: Windows 10.0.19045 X64
    ‚úî WebView2: 120.0.2210.144
    ‚úî MSVC: Visual Studio Community 2022
    ‚úî rustc: 1.77.0-nightly (5518eaa94 2024-01-29)
    ‚úî cargo: 1.77.0-nightly (7bb7b5395 2024-01-20)
    ‚úî rustup: 1.26.0 (5af9b9484 2023-04-05)
    ‚úî Rust toolchain: nightly-x86_64-pc-windows-msvc (environment override by RUSTUP_TOOLCHAIN)
    - node: 18.19.0
    - npm: 10.2.3

[-] Packages
    - tauri [RUST]: 2.0.0-alpha.21
    - tauri-build [RUST]: 2.0.0-alpha.14
    - wry [RUST]: 0.35.2
    - tao [RUST]: 0.24.1
    - tauri-cli [RUST]: 2.0.0-alpha.21
    - @tauri-apps/api Óúò: not installed!
    - @tauri-apps/cli [NPM]: 2.0.0-alpha.21

[-] App
    - build-type: bundle
    - CSP: unset
    - distDir: ../dist
    - devPath: http://localhost:3000/
    - framework: React (Next.js)
    - bundler: Webpack
```

### Stack trace

1.

```text
thread 'main' panicked at C:\Users\para\.cargo\registry\src\index.crates.io-6f17d22bba15001f\tauri-cli-2.0.0-alpha.21\src\mobile\mod.rs:317:6:
called `Result::unwrap()` on an `Err` value: AssetDirOutsideOfAppRoot { asset_dir: "assets", root_dir: "C:\\Users\\para\\Repos\\tapp\\src-tauri" }
stack backtrace:
   0:     0x7ff648ffeae2 - <unknown>
   1:     0x7ff649028f4d - <unknown>
   2:     0x7ff648ff7ea1 - <unknown>
   3:     0x7ff648ffe90a - <unknown>
   4:     0x7ff649001ac9 - <unknown>
   5:     0x7ff649001785 - <unknown>
   6:     0x7ff649001fe4 - <unknown>
   7:     0x7ff649001eb9 - <unknown>
   8:     0x7ff648fff3e9 - <unknown>
   9:     0x7ff649001b86 - <unknown>
  10:     0x7ff64908a3c7 - <unknown>
  11:     0x7ff64908a903 - <unknown>
  12:     0x7ff6480f8af1 - <unknown>
  13:     0x7ff6482ab710 - <unknown>
  14:     0x7ff6480f17b4 - <unknown>
  15:     0x7ff6480baf90 - <unknown>
  16:     0x7ff6480b7827 - <unknown>
  17:     0x7ff6480bc6f6 - <unknown>
  18:     0x7ff6480b703c - <unknown>
  19:     0x7ff648fee8a2 - <unknown>
  20:     0x7ff6480b79ec - <unknown>
  21:     0x7ff64903c1b0 - <unknown>
  22:     0x7fff8f5e7344 - BaseThreadInitThunk
  23:     0x7fff911a26b1 - RtlUserThreadStart
```

2.

```text
thread 'main' panicked at C:\Users\para\.cargo\registry\src\index.crates.io-6f17d22bba15001f\cargo-mobile2-0.8.0\src\util\path.rs:136:13:
internal error: entered unreachable code: `abs_src` and `abs_dest` have no common root
stack backtrace:
   0:     0x7ff648ffeae2 - <unknown>
   1:     0x7ff649028f4d - <unknown>
   2:     0x7ff648ff7ea1 - <unknown>
   3:     0x7ff648ffe90a - <unknown>
   4:     0x7ff649001ac9 - <unknown>
   5:     0x7ff649001785 - <unknown>
   6:     0x7ff649001fe4 - <unknown>
   7:     0x7ff649001e7b - <unknown>
   8:     0x7ff648fff3e9 - <unknown>
   9:     0x7ff649001b86 - <unknown>
  10:     0x7ff64908a3c7 - <unknown>
  11:     0x7ff64876de65 - <unknown>
  12:     0x7ff64832b855 - <unknown>
  13:     0x7ff6482ac520 - <unknown>
  14:     0x7ff6480f17b4 - <unknown>
  15:     0x7ff6480baf90 - <unknown>
  16:     0x7ff6480b7827 - <unknown>
  17:     0x7ff6480bc6f6 - <unknown>
  18:     0x7ff6480b703c - <unknown>
  19:     0x7ff648fee8a2 - <unknown>
  20:     0x7ff6480b79ec - <unknown>
  21:     0x7ff64903c1b0 - <unknown>
  22:     0x7fff8f5e7344 - BaseThreadInitThunk
  23:     0x7fff911a26b1 - RtlUserThreadStart
```


### Additional context

I am not sure if I should combine these together or create two separate issues.
Please let me know if I did anything wrong. Thank you!

body:
Could any of you who face this issue provide the directory structure of your drive, if possible with .gitignore if any exists, for example:

```
C:/
  |_ some-dir
    |_ .gitignore
    |_ some-another-dir
      |_ my-tauri-app
```

> Could any of you who face this issue provide the directory structure of your drive, if possible with .gitignore if any exists, for example:

As i said above, the problem happens when your node executable is not on the same drive as your project.

For me tauri project is in `G:\ruststuff\tauritest` node is `C:\Program Files\nodejs\node.exe`

I have a gitignore in `G:\ruststuff\tauritest` (the default one created by `yarn create tauri-app --alpha --template react-ts`)

There is no common root between different disks and it crashes with that "entered unreachable code" error.

If the project is anywhere on C: it works correctly.
I have a similar project structure and it worked fine, could you maybe run with `--verbose` flag, maybe it has more info

```
G:\ruststuff\tauritest>yarn tauri android init --verbose
yarn run v1.22.21
$ tauri android init --verbose
thread '<unnamed>' panicked at C:\Users\runneradmin\.cargo\registry\src\index.crates.io-6f17d22bba15001f\cargo-mobile2-0.10.2\src\util\path.rs:136:13:
internal error: entered unreachable code: `abs_src` and `abs_dest` have no common root
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace
Done in 1.42s.
```

@amrbashir are you on windows and is your project on a different disk than your nodejs.exe ?

The code that panics is here - https://github.com/tauri-apps/cargo-mobile2/blob/dev/src/util/path.rs#L130-L164

To me it looks like it assumes a posix filesystem that has one common root for everything, on windows it's not true so it gets into that "unreachable" branch.

> @amrbashir are you on windows and is your project on a different disk than your nodejs.exe ?

yes, also not sure why it is trying to find `nodejs.exe`. 

Finally, I can reproduce it, the issue seems to only happen with `yarn` and `cargo` as well, will look into this.

> > @amrbashir are you on windows and is your project on a different disk than your nodejs.exe ?
> 
> yes, also not sure why it is trying to find `nodejs.exe`.

I think it's this code: https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/blob/5a19147b06d03e7877ed2291e2bc6ff622aa939f/tooling/cli/src/mobile/init.rs#L107-L118

When running from yarn i think it loads the cli as a node module? (through @tauri-apps/cli npm package which then loads @tauri-apps/cli-win32-x64-msvc) so your argv[0] is node.exe

issue.title: fix(cli): CLI path issues on mobile project initialization

repository.name: tauri
repository.description: Build smaller, faster, and more secure desktop and mobile applications with a web frontend.

issue.body:
closes #8531

<!--
Before submitting a PR, please read https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/blob/dev/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request-guidelines

1. Give the PR a descriptive title.

  Examples of good title:
    - fix(windows): fix race condition in event loop
    - docs: update docstrings
    - feat: add `Window::set_fullscreen`

  Examples of bad title:
    - fix #7123
    - update docs
    - fix bugs

2. If there is a related issue, reference it in the PR text, e.g. closes #123.
3. If this change requires a new version, then add a change file in `.changes` directory with the appropriate bump, see https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/blob/dev/.changes/readme.md
4. Ensure that all your commits are signed https://docs.github.com/en/authentication/managing-commit-signature-verification/signing-commits
5. Ensure `cargo test` and `cargo clippy` passes.
6. Propose your changes as a draft PR if your work is still in progress.
-->

body: Thanks @bdew for your help, I made a PR to fix this.
